    For a discrete-time Markov chain, if the probability of transition i→ji \rightarrow ji→j does not depend on iii then the chain is reduced to a sequence of independent random variables (states). In this case, the chain forgets about its initial state and enters equilibrium after a single transition. In the continuous-time case, a Markov chain whose rates qijq_{i j}qij​ of transition i→ji \rightarrow ji→j depend on jjj but not on i≠ji \neq ji=j still 'remembers' its initial state and reaches equilibrium only in the limit as the time grows indefinitely.
